modules.title: Python Basics
modules.description: Learn the fundamentals of Python programming

lessons.title: Introduction to Python
lessons.description: Learn what Python is and why it's popular
lessons.codeExample:
print('Hello, Python!')
print('Welcome to Utsav\'s Python Learning Hub')

lessons.title: Python Syntax
lessons.description: Learn the basic syntax rules of Python
lessons.codeExample:
# This is a comment
print('Python has simple syntax')
if 5 > 2:
    print('Five is greater than two')

lessons.title: Python Variables
lessons.description: Learn how to create and use variables

lessons.title: Python Data Types
lessons.description: Learn about different data types in Python
lessons.codeExample:
x = 5       # int
y = 3.14    # float
z = "Hello"  # str
a = True    # bool

print(type(x))
print(type(y))
print(type(z))
print(type(a))

modules.title: Control Flow
modules.description: Learn how to control the flow of your Python programs

lessons.title: If...Else Statements
lessons.description: Learn how to make decisions in your code

lessons.title: Match Statements
lessons.codeExample:
# Python 3.10+ feature
status = 404

match status:
    case 200:
        print('OK')
    case 404:
        print('Not Found')
    case _:
        print('Unknown')

lessons.title: While Loops
lessons.description: Learn how to create while loops

lessons.title: For Loops
lessons.description: Learn how to create for loops

modules.title: Functions & Modules
modules.description: Learn how to create and use functions and modules

lessons.title: Python Functions
lessons.description: Learn how to create and call functions
lessons.codeExample:
def greet(name):
    return f'Hello, {name}!'

print(greet('Utsav'))

# Function with default parameter
def add(a, b=5):
    return a + b

print(add(3))      # 8
print(add(3, 7))   # 10

lessons.title: Lambda Functions
lessons.description: Learn about anonymous functions in Python
lessons.codeExample:
# Regular function
def double(x):
    return x * 2

# Equivalent lambda function
double_lambda = lambda x: x * 2

print(double(5))        # 10
print(double_lambda(5)) # 10

lessons.title: Python Modules
lessons.description: Learn how to use and create modules
lessons.codeExample:
# Using built-in modules
import math
from datetime import datetime

print(math.sqrt(16))  # 4.0
print(datetime.now()) # Current date and time

modules.title: Data Structures
modules.description: Learn about Python's built-in data structures

lessons.title: Python Lists
lessons.description: Learn how to create and manipulate lists
lessons.codeExample:
fruits = ['apple', 'banana', 'cherry']
print(fruits[0])  # apple

fruits.append('orange')
print(fruits)  # ['apple', 'banana', 'cherry', 'orange']

fruits.remove('banana')
print(fruits)  # ['apple', 'cherry', 'orange']

lessons.title: Python Tuples
lessons.codeExample:
coordinates = (10, 20)
print(coordinates[0])  # 10

# Tuples are immutable
# This will cause an error:
# coordinates[0] = 15

lessons.title: Python Dictionaries
lessons.codeExample:
person = {
    'name': 'Utsav',
    'age': 25,
    'city': 'Mumbai'
}

print(person['name'])  # Utsav

person['email'] = 'utsav@example.com'
print(person)  # Updated dictionary with email

lessons.title: Python Sets
lessons.description: Learn about unordered collections of unique items
lessons.codeExample:
fruits = {'apple', 'banana', 'cherry'}

# No duplicates allowed
fruits.add('apple')  # No effect
fruits.add('orange')
print(fruits)  # {'cherry', 'apple', 'banana', 'orange'} (order may vary)

modules.title: File Handling
modules.description: Learn how to work with files in Python

lessons.title: File Handling Basics
lessons.description: Learn how to work with files
lessons.codeExample:
# Reading a file
f = open('example.txt', 'r')
content = f.read()
print(content)
f.close()

# Using with statement (recommended)
with open('example.txt', 'r') as f:
    content = f.read()
    print(content)

lessons.title: Writing Files
lessons.description: Learn how to create and write to files
lessons.codeExample:
# Writing to a file
with open('example.txt', 'w') as f:
    f.write('Hello, World!')

# Appending to a file
with open('example.txt', 'a') as f:
    f.write('\nThis is a new line.')

lessons.title: Deleting Files
lessons.description: Learn how to delete files and directories
lessons.codeExample:
import os

# Check if file exists
if os.path.exists('example.txt'):
    # Delete file
    os.remove('example.txt')
    print('File deleted')
else:
    print('File does not exist')
